So, I took this quiz in the back of the book and I scored a five out of a possible twenty. Schizophrenia starts at twelve. So, they say it might be a... (reads off the pad) brief psychotic disorder. Whatever it is, I need to know what to do or what to get on to get this thing under control. Kendra stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. I'm a counselor. Certified, but I'm not a psychiatrist. I can't prescribe anything to you. I can talk to you, I can recommend where to send you, but that's it. Curtis begins to gather his things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that said, if you want to talk, I'll listen. For a lot of people that's a good start. Curtis hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you said here that your mother was diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia in her thirties. And you're at 35. You wanna talk about that? Curtis settles in his seat. Sets his book on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't know my mother's symptoms. I was just 10. My brother was 17. And, uh...I don't know. She just left me in the car in the parking lot at the grocery store one day. And she didn't come back. And then they found her a week later eatin' trash out of a dumpster in northern Kentucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad had to put her in the state hospital in Columbus. And she's been in assisted living ever since. Yep. My dad raised me. He died last April. Kendra nods, a pleasant look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me `bout these dreams. Curtis studies her face, bites at the inside of his cheek

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class has finished. PARENTS and KIDS trickle out. Samantha stands off to the side speaking with the Teacher

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what our schedule will be, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right. But I really do think you should continue with the sign language. And any additional therapies that kids need for the cochlear implant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. As Samantha talks to the Teacher, Curtis looks over flashcards with Hannah. He signs "SUNSHINE", a circle in sky with the hand then coming down, fingers spread.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. SAMANTHA'S CAR/INTERSTATE
dialogues.text: Curtis drives while Samantha and Hannah sleep in the back Surrounding farmland drops quickly into darkness joining purple sky in the distance. Through the passenger window, streak of lightning breaks across the horizon. Then anoth Curtis, seeing this, repositions to get a better look thr the window. It's horizontal lightning that appears to lea from cloud to cloud. Well defined bolts that strobe the night sky silhouetting towering thunderheads. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis looks back to Samantha and Hannah, still asleep. He pulls the car over to the shoulder of the interstate a continues watching. He climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SHOULDER OF THE INTERSTATE,
dialogues.text: Cars rush by as Curtis gently closes the car door. Keepin his eyes on the lightning storm, he walks to the shoulder It's a fantastic display of light. Hurried and intense. A BOLT of lightning reaches down to the ground. Sparks pop the earth in the distance. Another BOLT streaks down, getting closer. Curtis sees the traffic continuing to pass by at full spe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anyone seeing this? Curtis walks to the back window of the car and sees Saman sleeping inside. He reaches out to knock but stops himsel He turns back to the lightning and watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant rolling door curls up in the Delta Agri-Pro warehouse. Sunlight bounces off the finished concrete. Curtis pulls the chain for the door as Dewart slams the t latch down on the back of a DUMP TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. FLEA MARKET/LAFORCHE HOME
dialogues.text: -The Dump Truck and Tow Trailer sit parked on the street front of Curtis' house. Dewart stands at the back of the trailer with his hand on the ramp lever as Curtis reverse BACKHOE onto the street. -Samantha works her booth at the flea market. Hannah neat organizes a collection of colored beads on the floor. -A 20 foot rectangle has been outlined in bright orange p next to the storm shelter in Curtis' backyard. Other colo markings denote gas and water lines. The bucket on the Backhoe digs into the center of the dotted rectangle. -Dewart maneuvers the Backhoe's bucket and drops a load o earth into the bed of the Dump Truck. Red, the dog, barks the loud machinery from his pen. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Curtis uses a smaller trench digging machine on the back of the yard, radiating out from the main dig site. He notices a NEIGHBOR watching him from they yard next door. -Samantha tallies cash from the tackle box she uses as a register. Hannah counts out the change. -Dewart assembles a series of PVC pipe next to the trench Curtis dug. -Curtis, work goggles on, stands in a head deep hole hold a pneumatic jack hammer up to the exposed exterior wall o the storm shelter. He begins hammering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha's car pulls up and parks on the opposite side of street from their house. She gets out, puzzled by the Backhoe and Trailer parked in front of her house. Huge light brown tracks of dirt stripe the concrete drive Leading Hannah by the hand, Samantha follows the tracks t the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACKYARD,
dialogues.text: Samantha stops, mouth agape, stunned by what she sees. A 20 foot by 8 foot wide hole that is 10 feet deep sits i the middle of her yard. Smaller trenches lead out from it Dewart leans against the propane tank in the back corner the yard. He digs dirt from underneath his fingernails wi a pocket knife. Seeing Samantha, he waves a hand. Curtis' head appears from the hole. He stops when he sees Samantha. They stare at one another. He can see her surprise. He continues up the ladder and walks over to he Dewart watches from the back of the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. It's all right. Calm down. Samantha takes Hannah into the house without saying a wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind? She continues into the house. Curtis turns, frustrated. Dewart takes this in, then goes back to his nails. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah watches television in the den by herself.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM,
dialogues.text: Samantha sits on the edge of the bed. Curtis stands a few paces back. His hands dug into the back of his dusty jean

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a word. You didn't say one word about this to me. Don't you think you owe me that? Don't you think that you might respect me enough to at least consider what I had to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want you worryin' about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm worried Curtis. How are you paying for all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a home improvement loan from the bank. Samantha is stunned. She stands and gets in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you do that without talking to me? You know the expenses we have comin' up. You want to waste money on a stupid tornado shelter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doin' it...I'm doin' it for us. I know you don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I don't understand. I don't understand half the stuff you've been doin' lately. I don't understand you puttin' Red out back. I don't understand you stayin' up all night in that stupid tornado shelter. You don't come to bed half the time. You leave and don't tell me where you're goin'. Explain that to me. Please. Tell me something that helps me understand why you're bein' like this. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis can't look at her. He tries to find words but fail

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothin' to explain. Samantha stares at his face, searching for an answer. She on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go put Hannah to bed. Curtis walks out of the room. Samantha can't hold back, tears run down her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis stares at himself in the mirror. He opens the bott of prescription pills and shakes out two. Looks at them. Shakes out another three. He pops the pills in his mouth drinks from the faucet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark and quiet in the house. Samantha sleeps on her side, her back to Curtis. Her head is jostled. More. The bed begins to vibrate. Her eyes open. She turns over to see Curtis. He's having a SEIZURE. Samantha reaches for him. Eyes closed, his body convulses violently. Samantha quickly turns on a bedside lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis! She touches his arms. A small amount of BLOOD begins to trickle from both sides of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby. Oh, my God. Baby...Oh, my God. Baby. Samantha jumps off the bed and grabs a cordless phone on dresser. She dials, watching her husband continue to shak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need an ambulance! My husband's having a seizure. 41800 Tindale Road. Hurry up. He's bleeding! Samantha goes over to him. Holding her hands out, cautiou to touch him. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Okay. Okay. Samantha puts the phone receiver down on the nightstand. Operator's VOICE still coming through. She touches his ar Suddenly, the seizures stop. Curtis' body is still. Samantha freezes. His eyes open and he thrashes up in bed. Samantha jumps, tripping and stumbling backward. Curtis sucks short breaths into his lungs. His head darts back and forth, eyes wild. He sees Samantha staring up at him from the floor. He begins to calm down. Curtis touches his mouth. Sees the blood there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey? Samantha stands up and goes over to him. She sits on the edge of the bed and touches his arm. She's scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey? Are you okay? Curtis slowly nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were having a seizure. I called an ambulance. Curtis sees the phone on the nightstand and grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) No. It's fine. It's fine. Don't send an ambulance. It's fine. Curtis clicks off the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Curtis wraps his arms around her. He holds her tight. The SOUND of ambulance sirens approach from the distance. Samantha speaks, her voice trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby what's goin' on? 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance lights splash across the house. Curtis esco TWO EMTs down the front walk. He favors his left leg, walking with a slight limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you fellows had to come all the way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what we do. Now we can still take you in if you want a doctor to look at those cuts in your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's all right.. I'll see somebody on Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Curtis shakes their hands. He turns to walk back in the house and notices NEIGHBORS watching from their porches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis turns up a bottle of peroxide and swishes it in hi mouth. It burns. He spits into the kitchen sink. Samantha sits at the table watching him. Concerned, scare She holds a balled up tissue in her hand. Curtis takes a seat across the table. She waits for him to say something

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been honest with you. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been havin' these dreams. I guess they're more like nightmares. It's why I've been actin' like this. Samantha listens with a furrowed brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They always start with a kind of storm. Like a real powerful storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's always this dark, thick rain. Like fresh motor oil. And then the things, people, it just makes `em crazy. They attack me. Sometimes they go after Hannah. First one I had Red nearly chewed through my arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you put him out back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the dream? Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Dewart. We were at the job site. The storm started and somethin' happened. His face. His eyes were different. He came after me with a pick ax. And we fought. And he ran it through my leg. Curtis zones out for a moment. Samantha says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to explain, because it's not just a dream. It's a feeling. I'm afraid something might be comin'. Something that's...not right. I can not describe it. I just need you to believe me. Samantha's eyes are red. Her nose. She nods slightly and dabs the tissue at the corner of her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been to a counselor. I've seen her a few times. This makes Samantha look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I come from. And I promised myself...I promised myself I would never leave. And I am doin' everything that I can to make that true. The room is quiet. Samantha watches her husband. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah lies flat as the sled moves her through the oval C scanner. A red, lighted crosshair passes over her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha has Hannah on her lap. She and Curtis listen intently to an ATTENDANT who sits next to them with a fil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the doctor's approved her for surgery, We just need to get her scheduled. The next possible opening is... (reviews a calendar) The 21st of next month. That's six weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six weeks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis stands with Russell over the hood of a pick-up tru They look over a roll of ground water charts. Russell talks and points to the map, but Curtis' attentio focused elsewhere. He watches Dewart in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...this point just to the west. I don't think we'll have any problem. We should be able to get twenty, maybe thirty in this next week. But we're looking to see how that's gonna shape up, so... Dewart smiles and makes broad gestures with his arms. He' telling a story to Dave, who laughs hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis? His attention snaps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That sounds good. We'll get it done. Russell rolls up the charts. They walk toward the work si toward Dewart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim fills out paperwork at his desk. There is a KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in. Curtis walks inside. He stands in front of the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you need Curtis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a favor Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you take Dewart off my crew? Just reassign him someplace else. Jim sets his pen down and leans back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the trouble? He not pullin' his weight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nothin' like that. He's a good worker. He's a good man. He's my friend. I think it'd be easier not being in charge of someone I'm so close to. Jim nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I understand. This is part of what it means to manage people Curtis. You're gonna have to learn that. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. I appreciate that but... well it would just be very helpful in this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Well, I can put him with Russell. Anybody else you prefer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Whoever you think's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Curtis turns to leave the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been missin' a lotta work Curtis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. My daughter's had a lot of doctor's visits. I haven't let anything get behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But don't. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir. Curtis shows himself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has just set and a purple hue hangs over everythi Curtis stands in the very back of the yard and watches a guide a long, flatbed trailer up the driveway. An 18 foot metal SHIPPING CONTAINER rides on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nat and Samantha sit at the kitchen table going over a li of food in a note pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know they just usually do oysters and fries but what if we did something healthier on the side? 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What like slaw? Nat gets up to refill her drink. She looks out the back d and surveys the construction zone. A FORKLIFT lowers the Shipping Container into the giant hole in the backyard. N shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe a vegetable or salad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewart's been tellin' me how strange Curtis has been actin' lately. I am so sorry. Nat brings her drink back to the table and sits. Samantha doesn't look up from her pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like you don't have enough on your plate with Hannah. Nat puts her hand on Samantha's. Samantha moves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are fine. We're fine. Nat smiles sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis meanders inside. He sees police tactical and survi gear behind the counter. Chief among them is a collection gas masks hanging on the rear partition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Can I look at one of these gas masks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Which one you want to look at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The newest one. The OWNER of the store removes a mask and hands it to him Curtis fiddles with the mask. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One seventy eight. Curtis frowns at the price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything cheaper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's the cheapest one I got in the store. They go all the way up to two ninety. I don't know what you want to spend but a gas mask ain't something you want to go cheap on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any kids sizes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Kids can't wear those. They got a have a special thing, its like a hood. I don't fool with those. Curtis nods. The perusing Shopper listens in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ring me up a couple of `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis stands at the driver's door of his pick-up. The bo sits on the seat in front of him. He opens it and removes one of the gas masks. He stares into its vacant plastic eyes. He drops the mask back into the box and shakes his head. Sighs, frustrated with it all. He checks over his shoulder, scans the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis stands on top of the shipping container that rests the hole roughly a foot below the yard. Wearing tinted goggles, he cuts a circular hole in the top of the contai with a small blowtorch. The sparks stop and Curtis raises the goggles to inspect work. He kicks at the weld with the heel of his boot and metal falls into the container. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets down the torch and removes a roof turbine vent fr cardboard box and holds it up next to the newly cut hole.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doin'? Curtis smiles to himself. He turns to find KYLE(42) stand at the edge of the hole. His hands are tucked into the ba of his jeans and he's sizing up the work. Curtis steps off the roof of the shipping container onto ground level. He holds out a hand and Kyle shakes it, nev taking his eyes off the unfinished shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got goin' on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just addin' on to the storm shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just `cause. Kyle notices the PVC piping running in the trenches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You runnin' water to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. From our well. Runnin' sewer out to the city line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you spendin' on this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look it. Curtis shrugs. Kyle sees his reluctance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take your eye off the ball one minute in this economy and you're screwed. You got the cash for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't put nothin' on credit cards. That shit'll eat you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. Kyle is staring him down. Curtis just looks at the shelte There's a long silence shared between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha called me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured. Curtis climbs back onto the shipping container and contin installing the roof vent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Called you to come tell me to quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She called `cause she's worried. Says you've been stressed out. Curtis doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stressed out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No more than anybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, huh...Hey, look. You wanna come by and have dinner sometime, Kyle. That's fine. We'll have a beer and talk about the old days, but you got somethin' to say just say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stop that shit right now. I'll come over there and remind you what it feels like to get your ass whipped. Curtis keeps his head down, scolded. Kyle relents. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just coming here to check on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I appreciate it Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been to see Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. A few days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should see her. Take your girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'll get around to it. There's an awkward moment as Curtis works with his back t Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a hand? Curtis turns and looks up at him. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I've got it. Kyle nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Call me if you need me okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. Kyle looks at him for a moment. He turns and walks toward the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Kyle? Kyle turns back. Curtis climbs onto the yard and walks ov to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually you could do me a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still looking for a dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Kyle looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis slaps down the tailgate to Kyle's truck, which is parked in the driveway. Red, tail wagging, hops up into t bed. Curtis closes the tailgate and sets a leash and two bowls into the back of the truck. Curtis rubs Red behind the ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got a good spot for you, okay bud. Kyle stands at the passenger door to the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it'll make my girls happy. All right. Kyle walks around the truck to the driver's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Kyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Kyle stops. Curtis walks up and hugs him. Kyle slaps him the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. All right. I will little brother. You take care of your family. Handle your business. Okay? Curtis nods. Kyle smiles, shaking his head. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Kyle climbs into the truck and cranks it. Curtis steps ba as he pulls away. Red looks back from the bed of the truc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah, fresh from the tub, stands to let Curtis rub her head with a towel. He finishes and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Bedtime. Hannah looks up at him. Curtis signs his hand like a pill then touches his watch. They move out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis sits on the edge of his bed staring at the window their room. He's already dressed for work. He watches as the thick, dark rain hits the window and streaks. He has a curious look on his face. MOVING, down the hall. MOVING, past the den. MOVING, into the kitchen. Curtis stops at the entry to the kitchen. Samantha, weari a robe, stands with her back to him. She's cooking someth at the stove. Curtis notices the back door standing open. HARD RAIN sla down outside. He looks down at the tile floor. WET FOOTPRINTS track inside. They lead to where Samantha is standing. She turns to him She's pale with a vacant look on her face. Her hair is soaking wet. Curtis looks at her, concerned. She stares back, emotionless. She slowly looks down at the counter next to her. A kitchen knife rests there. Curtis looks at the knife. They look at one another again 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis sits at the breakfast table across from Hannah. He looks over at Samantha. She cooks, her back to him. Hanna climbs out of her chair and goes to look out the back doo Samantha turns and dishes eggs onto Curtis' plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? She touches his hand. Curtis FLINCHES. Their eyes meet. He wants to take it back, and she can se that. It begins to sink in for her. Hannah vocalizes something behind them. Samantha looks at her husband, shakes her head in disbeli Hannah makes another sound, pounds on the back door. Samantha turns and sees a MAN standing in their backyard. She flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that? Curtis stands to see out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Curtis' boss, stands with his hands on his hips look down at the planted shipping container. Curtis approaches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis. Dewart told me you took equipment from work for a project at your house. Said that's why you wanted him off your crew. I came out here to see it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was just a hauler and a backhoe. It was Saturday. I had `em back in less than 8 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that doesn't matter. I can't even tell you how many rules you broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you had an accident? Huh? What if you ran somebody over on your way out here? Lawsuit like that could bankrupt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sorry Jim. I hadn't thought of that. Thank God nothin' like that happened. You know? I'll do whatever I can to make it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can pick up your last check on Friday. You've got two weeks benefits. Curtis nods. Accepts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you fire Dewart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on two weeks leave unpaid... I'm sorry Curtis. You did this to yourself. Jim turns and walks out of the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha clears the table. Hannah sits, watching her fath walk in. Curtis stops just inside the door, closes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been fired. Samantha continues clearing the dishes to the sink. She doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the health insurance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get two more weeks. Samantha slams the plates into the sink. They break. She holds her head back and stares at the ceiling. She walks over to Curtis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... ...and SLAPS him across the face. Hannah begins to cry. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha turns and collects Hannah from the table. She gr her things and walks out of the house. Curtis stands alone in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis walks down the hallway to Kendra's office. The doo ajar, he knocks and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis finds ANDY(42), a man in khakis and a button up, sitting behind the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, `scuse me. Andy rises from his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Curtis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in. Kendra transferred out. I'll be meeting with you today. Curtis looks at the man. He's kind of mincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, sit down. Curtis takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Kendra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got into a program at OSU so she'll be transferring near there. I've split her case load with another counselor. It's been kind of crazy around here lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I've looked over your file. It says your mother was diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia in her early thirties. Let's start there. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis looks at the man for a moment, then stands and wal out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis' truck is parked in the driveway with the hood up the engine running. Curtis stands over the vibrating engine, studying it. He looks at the belts. He watches them move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis hefts a porcelain toilet down the steps of the shelter. A dull light glows through the new entryway that been knocked out through the back left wall. Curtis goes through it.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SHIPPING CONTAINER SECTION,
dialogues.text: Curtis sets the toilet on the floor. He picks up the camp lantern and holds it up to the space. The lack of light makes it feel more cavernous than it is Two cots have been brought down as well as an assortment supplies. Canned food, a small gas burner. Curtis hangs the lantern onto a hook on the wall and goes about connecting the toilet to a pipe sticking out of the back corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha walks inside followed by Hannah and a WOMAN from flea market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. I completely forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. I hope you like them. Samantha hands over the plastic bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I brought cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's terrific. It's fine. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha takes three twenties from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me if they don't work and I'm sorry again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's okay. Thank you. Samantha closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN,
dialogues.text: Samantha takes the tin decorated with ocean creatures dow from the fridge. She removes the envelope with the word "BEACH" written on it and takes out a stack of bills. She folds the bills over and stuffs them into her purse before placing the empty envelope back in the tin. She looks out back and sees Curtis sitting with Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE,
dialogues.text: The shipping container has been covered over with dirt. T rotating vents spin at either end of the brown mound. Cur sits on the freshly packed dirt signing with Hannah. He signs something that makes her laugh. Hannah smacks a muddy clump between her hands. Curtis touches her nose, leaving a dirt smudge. Hannah laughs. She touches his fac smudging it.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN,
dialogues.text: Samantha watches through the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha tucks Hannah into bed. She kisses her on the hea and turns out the bedside lamp. Samantha leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha steps out of the house. She walks over to Curtis who is standing on a grassy section of the yard over an assortment of auto parts. They don't speak for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the alternator from the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just trying to figure out a way to charge enough batteries to run lights down there. Ah, what the hell? Maybe I'll hook it up to your old exercycle. Samantha almost smiles. Curtis keeps his eyes on the part

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna leave me? Samantha looks at his hands. They hang by his sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You flinched when I touched your hand this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in one of your dreams? Curtis nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you deal with that? He holds open his hand to her. She takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Then I made a decision. We cancel the beach trip. We have enough to cover bills for the next two months with your last check. I'm going to get a job. You're gonna find another job. I'm going to call to see if we can move Hannah's surgery up. We'll need to see what it costs to extend your policy to the end of the year. I want you to see a psychiatrist. Not a counselor from the free clinic. Someone good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Shannan gave me the number of somebody. But, uh, I just don't think we can afford it. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find the money. Also, the Lions Club supper's this weekend. I want you to come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to see any of those people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to go. I need to do something normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Curtis nods. Samantha let's go of his hand and walks back the house. Curtis goes back to studying the auto parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inside of the club is a musty banquet hall with wood panelled walls and a drop tile ceiling. The place is pack Rows of folding tables fill the center of the room. A lon LINE has formed along the side wall that wraps to a servi station at the back. Heated metal bins filled with fried oysters and french fries. Curtis gets in line with his family.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SERVING TABLE,
dialogues.text: Curtis holds two paper plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many pieces does Hannah get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one. Curtis uses tongs to grab pieces of fried oyster. Looking up, he can see back through the kitchen to an open door outside. Dewart stands there over a butane fired frying p He wears an apron and stares at Curtis. Curtis moves down the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lewis sits with Cammie and their baby. He laughs and talk with another man. From a different table, Russell leans o to eye Curtis. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis sits at a table with his family. He loads Hannah's plate up with ketchup. A tap on his shoulder. Curtis turns to find Dewart standi over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here man. Dewart taps him on the shoulder again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said what are you doin' here. Curtis stands and Dewart takes a step back. The general noise of the place starts to quiet down as people take notice. A few stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told people what you been doin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cut me loose. Everything we been through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm sorry. Dewart shoves him in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't fucking sorry. You sorry you wouldn't cut me loose. We fuckin' friends! This how you treat friends? Curtis places a hand on Dewart's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Dewart punches Curtis in the face. It stings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God dammit. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha gathers Hannah and moves back. Dewart shoves Cur across the table. Oysters and bottles go everywhere. The entire room is on its feet watching. Curtis slips getting up. Dewart walks around the table, heading for him.

dialogues.speaker: STOP IT DEWART
dialogues.text: Curtis stands and kicks Dewart in the knee. It buckles ba and he's on the floor. He cries out and grabs the twisted joint. He's done. Curtis paces over him, covered in ketchup and soda. He shouts down at him.

dialogues.speaker: I SAID NOT HERE
dialogues.text: He wipes at his face. Sees all of the people staring at h Addresses them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm crazy?! Huh! Is that what he told you! Curtis TURNS OVER A TABLE. He points to the gawking crowd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, listen up! There is a storm comin' like nothing you have ever seen. And not a one of you is prepared for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm crazy? I'M TALKIN'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS! You think I'm a thief? Hannah watches. THE SOUND MUTED. She looks on as Curtis paces, pointing and yelling, red faced at the crowd. Curtis backs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep well in your beds. Cause if this thing comes true, there ain't gonna be any more. Curtis looks down at Dewart. He turns to see Hannah. She's tucked under her Mother's l crying. This hits him hard. He stops. Looking at Samantha his eyes fill with tears. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha, leading Hannah by the hand, walks to Curtis. He stares at her, on the verge of breaking down. She takes her hand and gently pulls his head down to her shoulder. Without another look toward the crowd, Samantha leads her family out of the dining hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah stands on a toolbox and rests her elbows on the si of Curtis' truck. The hood is open. She watches her fathe fiddle with re-installing the alternator. His fingers covered in grease. Hannah steps down from the toolbox and walks into the fro yard. Curtis pauses, hearing a high-pitched, warbling SOU in the distance. He notices Hannah is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah? He pulls his head out from the hood and sees Hannah stand on the curb. She looks down the street. He runs down his driveway, wiping his hands on a rag and watching the hori

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah! A FLOCK OF BIRDS, flying in intricate geometric patterns, swarm above the house at the end of the street. They twis and bend into speckled black shapes. Hannah, watching, walks into the street. Curtis catches h by the hand. He turns away from the birds to see a STORM CELL building on the opposite horizon. He scoops Hannah i his arms, stepping back from it. The SOUND of the birds grows louder. Curtis pivots to fin the mass of birds barreling down the street toward him. H turns away as the wall of birds crash past him. The force powerful it knocks him backward. He covers Hannah's head, dodging the onslaught of wind an wings. The Flock passes. Curtis stands, his face cut and scraped. Hannah cries, clinging to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: The windshield of a car parked next to him SHATTERS. Curt looks at the broken glass. A dead bird, it's neck broken, rests crumpled on the hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another bird crashes into the asphalt just in front of hi Then another. Curtis looks up. The Flock of birds are circling overhead and diving down at him. More birds crashing to the ground. Curtis covers his head The neighborhood's tornado SIRENS begin to sound. Curtis rushes Hannah toward his front door as dozens of b plummet from the sky. The sirens BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis wakes to Samantha shaking him by the shoulders. Sh nearly on top of him in the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis! Wake up! Wake up! TORNADO SIRENS continue to scream throughout the neighborhood. Curtis looks to the window. Rain and hail are battering t house. He jumps to his feet and grabs Samantha by the arm They rush out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis bursts into the room. Hannah is standing at the window looking out. Curtis scoops her up, scaring her. Sh begins to cry as they run from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind blows fiercely as pellets of hail bounce off the gro Rain cuts at a sharp angle. The Tornado Sirens continue. Curtis, Hannah in his arms and Samantha close behind, exi the back of the house and heads to the storm shelter. He passes Hannah to Samantha and fumbles with the padlock ke At the doors to the shelter, Samantha holds her robe up t shield Hannah from the hail. Curtis gets the lock and ope the door. They go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis slams the doors behind them. It's pitch black unti he gets to the switch on the lantern. The room fills with the orange glow as Curtis snaps the padlock through the d handles. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. It's okay. Curtis leads them through the entry to the larger section the shelter. Samantha takes Hannah and sits with her on o of the cots. She's signing to her, trying to calm her dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. All right. Come on. Sit down. Curtis goes to a trunk in the corner and begins rooting through it. He removes two gas masks and an oxygen mask connected to a small tank. He goes over and kneels in front of Hannah. He tries slipping the oxygen mask over her face. Samantha grabs hi wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Don't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's oxygen. Here. Put this on. Curtis hands Samantha a gas mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please just do it. Okay? He looks to Hannah and places an oxygen mask over her fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we go. All right. Keep it out of your eyes. Okay? He signs to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I love you. It's okay. Curtis eases on the knob at the top of the tank. He climbs onto the cot and puts his arm around them. He slips on his gas mask. Samantha is hesitant. She looks at her husband in the mas and leans back against the side of the container. Hannah looks up at her. She touches her mother's mask. Samantha slips on the gas mask. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camping lantern on the floor casts long shadows up. T faint boom of thunder rolls softly outside. The family sits huddled together on the cot, wearing thei masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CRACK of thunder rattles the shelter. Curtis snaps awak still wearing his gas mask. Samantha has climbed on the other cot and is asleep. Hann sleeps under Curtis' arm. He gently lays her down on the and stands to stretch. He walks into the original section of the shelter and gra small flashlight off the metal shelving. He clicks it on moves over to the concrete steps. He takes a seat and listens. He places his hand onto the metal door. A BOOM of thunder. He can hear the rain and wind blowing outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha rubs Curtis' shoulder, gently waking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up babe. Curtis' head moves. He sees that Samantha and Hannah have removed their masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your mask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took them off. It's fine. Take it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Curtis hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine. Take it off. Curtis slips the mask off his face. Worried, he takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to open the door now. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis doesn't move. He looks at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's...What if it's not over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's not over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over. Get the keys. Open the door. Curtis slowly gets to his feet. He sees the dark entryway the original section of the shelter. Taking the lantern, walks to it. Samantha and Hannah follow. Curtis stops just inside. He holds the lantern up, illuminating the padlocked metal doors. He looks back at his family, then climbs the steps. He places his hand on the door. He flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still storming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hear it. Samantha stares at him. The room is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your hand on the door. You can feel it. He takes Samantha's wrist and guides her to the doors. He watches her face as she places a hand against the metal. looks at him, her eyes getting red, and shakes her head " Curtis kneels in front of Hannah and mimics the signs fro earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (signing and speaking) Thunder? Do you feel it? 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flinches again. Looks to the ceiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (signing and speaking) You feel it? You feel it? Hannah walks to her mother. Samantha holds onto her. Curtis steps back from them. They watch him, their backs the doors. He flinches and covers his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, there's no storm outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Samantha walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis. I wouldn't lie to you. We love you very much. Please open the door. Curtis is on the verge of tears. He slowly reaches into his jeans pocket. He removes the keys. He holds them out to Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I can't. Samantha looks at the keys, then at Curtis. Tears shake f his trembling face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, but if I open the door, then nothin's gonna change. You'll see that everything's fine, but nothing will change. Please. This is what it means to stay with us. This is something you have to do. He looks at Hannah, then Samantha. Curtis steadies himsel trying to control his flinching. He wipes his face with t back of his hands and takes a deep breath. Curtis walks toward the doors. On the steps, he reaches u to the padlock. The keys shake in his fingers. He turns t Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you move Hannah back? 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha picks Hannah up in her arms and Curtis watches t retreat to the rear wall. He goes back to the lock. He inserts the key. The padlock pops open. Curtis removes it. He looks back at Samantha, then flings open the doors. SUNLIGHT. It's blinding. Curtis holds his hand up to cover his eyes He stares up at a crystal blue sky. Samantha watches as Curtis steps out of the shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis rises through the storm shelter's entryway. Out of the corner of his eye he catches, A MAN PASSING BY. Curtis is startled. He turns to see a CREW of MEN from th power company hoisting a ladder onto the pole at the corn of the house. A power line dangles overhead. He turns to see NEIGHBORS in their yards clearing debris. Leaves and branches clutter the ground. The aftermath of storm. Samantha steps out of the shelter holding Hannah. She surveys the damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. She walks over to Curtis and hugs him. He kisses Samantha the head. Curtis looks up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis sits with Samantha in the plush office of a PSYCHIATRIST(56). Curtis rubs his hand over the soft leat upholstery on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any vacation time that you could use?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a job right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I know that times are hard, but I think it's really important for you to separate yourself from that storm shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you need to break away from it for awhile. We can start you on some medication that I think will help, but that action alone would mean a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We usually go on a trip to Myrtle Beach every summer. We were gonns go this month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that would be okay if we start the medication now. It would give you all some time to prepare as a family, but I want to be clear, when Curtis gets back he'll need to take more time than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean that he'll need hands on therapy at a real facility. Curtis looks up for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean I have to leave my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you need to seriously commit to some treatment. Curtis processes this. Samantha takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis scoops handfuls of sand out of a foot deep hole on beach. He slops the wet mixture into a castle shaped buck his back to the shoreline of gentle, breaking waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (signing and speaking) Hey. Good, huh? Hannah sits on her knees in front of Curtis sprinkling dr sand over castle shaped mounds already formed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha drops four hotdogs into a boiling pot of water a stirs a bubbling pot of canned chili. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beach condo is small, but brightly furnished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wooden deck hangs off the back of the beach condo. A picnic table is set with plastic place mats and forks. WI lifts the corner of a stack of napkins. The wind blows harder, fanning the napkins off the table.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BEACH,
dialogues.text: Curtis, still working in the sand, puts a top on the sand castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. We put a top on it. Curtis smooths out the sand in the castle shaped bucket a turns it over to top off their sand mound. He hands the bucket over for Hannah to refill. The SOUND of the waves behind them has STOPPED. They don' notice. Curtis takes two fingers and digs a small trench around t sand castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis looks up ready to sign the letters but sees Hannah staring at the water. She looks at him and signs somethin with her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it honey? Curtis misses it. He shakes his head, "no", and Hannah si again, slowly: "S-T-O-R-M".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Curtis turns to the shoreline, getting to his feet. He looks down at Hannah, who watches, mesmerized. Scared, she looks to her father. He grabs her under the arms and rests her on his hip. She buries her head into his chest.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CONDO,
dialogues.text: A gust of wind greets Samantha as she walks out onto the holding a plate of hotdogs and a bowl of chili. She stops seeing the horizon. Her mouth falls open. She slowly sets the plate and bowl down on the table, her mind racing. She looks down at Curtis in disbelief. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis looks up to the Condo and makes eye contact. He studies her face. Samantha looks at her husband, trying to process it all. looks out at the horizon then back down to Curtis. Concer on her face, she nods to him. Curtis sees her nod. Samantha's eyes, still locked on Curtis, soften, as if to apologize. After a moment, she mouths to him, "I love you Curtis nods back to her. She looks back up to the shoreline.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BEACH,
dialogues.text: Curtis' feet kick up sand as he rushes back toward the co

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CONDO,
dialogues.text: Samantha hasn't moved from the porch. A light rain begins fall. Her hands grip the railing. She turns her left palm up. Dark rain collects there.

dialogues.speaker: WITH LAYERS OF HORIZONTAL LIGHTNING.
dialogues.text: Behind Samantha, Curtis appears in the open sliding door clutching Hannah. The Storm Cell is reflected in the glas next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam. Samantha looks down at her palm. She rubs the thick, visc rain in her fingers. She looks back up at the storm. On Samantha's face,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. THE END.
